subject: A longer example text for comparing mapping proposals
msgSnippet: Here is the text from page 25 of the QM, written out in traditional spelling (if anyone spots mistakes, please let me know): When Drake climbed the tree in
messageBody:
Here is the text from page 25 of the QM, written out in traditional
spelling (if anyone spots mistakes, please let me know):

When Drake climbed the tree in Panama, and saw both oceans, and vowed that
he would sail a ship in the Pacific; when he crawled out upon the cliffs of
Tierra del Fuego, and leaned his head over the southernmost angle of the world;
when he scoured a furrow round the globe with his keel, and received the
homage of the barbarians of the antipodes in the name of the Virgin
Queen; he was another man from what he had become after twenty years of
court life and intrigue, and Spanish fighting, and gold-hunting. There is
a tragic solemnity in his end, if we take it as the last act of his career;
but it is his life, not his death, which we desire - not what he failed to do,
but what he did... (Froude, on Drake)

Father Adam had a cart, and to draw the cart a diminutive she-ass,
not much bigger than a dog, the color of a mouse, with a kindly eye and
a determined under-jaw. There was something neat and high-bred, a Quakerish
elegance, about the rogue that hit my fancy on the spot.
To prove her good temper, one child after another was set upon
her back to ride, and one after another went head over heels into the air;
until a want of confidence began to rain in youthful bosoms, and the
experiment was discontinued from a dearth of subjects... At length she
passed into my service for the consideration of sixty-five franks and a glass
of brandy. (Stevenson: 'Travels with a donkey')

For purposes of comparison, here is the text in QS, using each
keyboard mapping proposal:

Jerome kbd:
{ `eG /drEk klFmd H trI iG /pAnumy, n sY bOT OSGz, n vQd Ht
h wd sEl a Sip iG H /pasifik; `eG h krYld Qt apoG H klifs v
/tiera del fUEgO, n lIGd hz hed Ovar H saHarGmOst ANgl v H warld;
`eG h skYrd a farO rQnd H glOb wi hz kIl, n risIvd H
homaJ v H byrbErianz v H AntipOdIz iG H nEm v H /varJiG
/kwIG; h waz anaHar mAn fm ` h hAd bikum Aftar tweGti jIarz v
kYrt lFf n iGtrIg, n /spAniS fFtN, n gOld-hantN. HEr z
a trAJik sulemniti iG hz eGd, if w tEk i A H lAst Akt v hz karIar;
bt i z hz lFf, not hz deT, c w dizFr - not ` h fEld t d,
bt ` h dd... (/frMd, o /drEk)

/fyHar Adam hd a kart, n t drY H kyrt a dimiGMtiv SI-As,
not mc bigar Hn a dog, H kular v a mQs, wi a kFndli F n
a ditarmiGd andar-JY. HEr wz samTiN GIt n hF-bred, a kwEkariS
eligans, abQt H rOg Ht hit mF fAnsi o H spot.
t prMv har gd tempar, wan cFld Aftar anaHar waz set apoG
har bAk t rFd, n wan Aftar anaHar weGt hed Ovar hIlz iGt H Er;
antil a woGt v koGfidans bigAn t rEG iG jMTful bUzumz, n H
e?perimant waz diskGtiGajMd fm a darT v sabJekds... At leNT S
pAst iGt mF sarvis f H kGsidarESG v si?ti-fFv frANks n a glAs
v brAndi. (/stIvansan: 'trAvlz wi a doNki')}

QS-SAMPA:
{ WEq `drek klYmd D tri Iq `panVmA, n sO boT oSqz, n vHd Dt
h wd sel y SIp Iq D `pysIfIk; WEq h krOld Ht ypQq D klIfs v
`tIEry dEl fUego, n liqd hz hEd ovyr D syDyrqmost aNgl v D wyrld;
WEq h skOrd y fyro rHnd D glob wI hz kil, n rIsivd D
hQmyJ v D bArberIynz v D antIpodiz Iq D nem v D `vyrJIq
`kwiq; h wyz ynyDyr man fm W h had bIkVm aftyr twEqtI jiyrz v
kOrt lYf n Iqtrig, n `spanIS fYtN, n gold-hyntN. Der z
y traJIk sVlEmnItI Iq hz Eqd, If w tek I a D last akt v hz kyriyr;
bt I z hz lYf, nQt hz dET, c w dIzYr - nQt W h feld t d,
bt W h dd... (`frud, Q `drek)

`fADyr adym hd y kyrt, n t drO D kArt y dImIqutIv Si-as,
nQt mc bIgyr Dn y dQg, D kVlyr v y mHs, wI y kYndlI Y n
y dItyrmIqd yndyr-JO. Der wz symTIN qit n hY-brEd, y kwekyrIS
ElIgyns, ybHt D rog Dt hIt mY fansI Q D spQt.
t pruv hyr gd tEmpyr, wyn cYld aftyr ynyDyr wyz sEt ypQq
hyr bak t rYd, n wyn aftyr ynyDyr wEqt hEd ovyr hilz Iqt D er;
yntIl y wQqt v kQqfIdyns bIgan t req Iq juTfVl bUzVmz, n D
EXpErImynt wyz dIskqtIqyjud fm y dyrT v sybJEkds... at lENT S
past Iqt mY syrvIs f D kqsIdyreSq v sIXtI-fYv fraNks n y glas
v brandI. (`stivynsyn: 'travlz wI y dQNkI')}

Peter Guinness:
{ PeM `drAk klImd D trE iM `panGmR, n sQ bOT OSMz, n vWd Dt
h wd sAl u Sip iM D `pusifik; PeM h krQld Wt upoM D klifs v
`tieru del fVAgO, n lEMd hz hed Ovur D suDurMmOst aNgl v D wurld;
PeM h skQrd u furO rWnd D glOb wi hz kEl, n risEvd D
homuj v D bRrbAriunz v D antipOdEz iM D nAm v D `vurjiM
`kwEM; h wuz unuDur man fm P h had bikGm aftur tweMti yEurz v
kQrt lIf n iMtrEg, n `spaniS fItN, n gOld-huntN. DAr z
u trajik sGlemniti iM hz eMd, if w tAk i a D last akt v hz kurEur;
bt i z hz lIf, not hz deT, C w dizIr - not P h fAld t d,
bt P h dd... (`frUd, o `drAk)

`fRDur adum hd u kurt, n t drQ D kRrt u dimiMUtiv SE-as,
not mC bigur Dn u dog, D kGlur v u mWs, wi u kIndli I n
u diturmiMd undur-jQ. DAr wz sumTiN MEt n hI-bred, u kwAkuriS
eliguns, ubWt D rOg Dt hit mI fansi o D spot.
t prUv hur gd tempur, wun CIld aftur unuDur wuz set upoM
hur bak t rId, n wun aftur unuDur weMt hed Ovur hElz iMt D Ar;
until u woMt v koMfiduns bigan t rAM iM yUTfGl bVzGmz, n D
eXperimunt wuz diskMtiMuyUd fm u durT v subjekds... at leNT S
past iMt mI survis f D kMsidurASM v siXti-fIv fraNks n u glas
v brandi. (`stEvunsun: 'travlz wi u doNki')}

BPJ2:
{ WeN `drEk klYmd D trI iN `pancmA, n sQ bOT OSNz, n vBd Dt

Here is the text from page 25 of the QM, written out in traditional
spelling (if anyone spots mistakes, please let me know):

    When Drake climbed the tree in Panama, and saw both oceans, and vowed that
he would sail a ship in the Pacific; when he crawled out upon the cliffs of
Tierra del Fuego, and leaned his head over the southernmost angle of the world;
when he scoured a furrow round the globe with his keel, and received the
homage of the barbarians of the antipodes in the name of the Virgin
Queen; he was another man from what he had become after twenty years of
court life and intrigue, and Spanish fighting, and gold-hunting. There is
a tragic solemnity in his end, if we take it as the last act of his career;
but it is his life, not his death, which we desire - not what he failed to do,
but what he did...                                         (Froude, on Drake)

    Father Adam had a cart, and to draw the cart a diminutive she-ass,
not much bigger than a dog, the color of a mouse, with a kindly eye and
a determined under-jaw. There was something neat and high-bred, a Quakerish
elegance, about the rogue that hit my fancy on the spot.
   To prove her good temper, one child after another was set upon
her back to ride, and one after another went head over heels into the air;
until a want of confidence began to rain in youthful bosoms, and the
experiment was discontinued from a dearth of subjects... At length she
passed into my service for the consideration of sixty-five franks and a glass
of brandy.                               (Stevenson: 'Travels with a donkey')

For purposes of comparison, here is the text in QS, using each
keyboard mapping proposal:
